info.title: Vellum Client API
info.description: ## Vellum API Documentation ### Welcome ðŸ‘‹ Welcome to Vellum's API documentation! Here you'll find information about the various endpoints available to you, as well as the parameters and responses that they accept and return. We will be exposing more and more of our APIs over time as they stabilize. If there is some action you can perform via the UI that you wish you could perform via API, please let us know and we can expose it here in an unstable state. ### API Stability Some of the APIs documented within are undergoing active development. Use the Stable and Unstable tags to differentiate between those that are stable and those that are not. ### Base URLs Some endpoints are hosted separately from the main Vellum API and therefore have a different base url. If this is the case, they will say so in their description. Unless otherwise specified, all endpoints use https://api.vellum.ai as their base URL. ### Official API Clients: Vellum maintains official API clients for Python and Node/Typescript. We recommend using these clients to interact with all stable endpoints. You can find them here: - [Python](https://github.com/vellum-ai/vellum-client-python) - [Node/Typescript](https://github.com/vellum-ai/vellum-client-node)

get.description: Unstable Used to retrieve a deployment given its ID or name.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Either the Deployment's ID or its unique name

post.description: Unstable Creates a new document index.

Example1.description: This example shows how to create a document index that vectorizes documents using an instructor model.

Example2.summary: Index Using a Sentence Transformers Model
Example2.description: This example shows how to create a document index that vectorizes documents using a Sentence Transformers model.

Example3.description: This example shows how to create a document index that vectorizes documents using one of OpenAI's embedding models.

get.description: Stable Used to list documents. Optionally filter on supported fields.

parameters.name: document_index_id
parameters.description: Filter down to only those documents that are included in the specified index. You may provide either the Vellum-generated ID or the unique name of the index specified upon initial creation.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

post.description: Unstable Executes a deployed Workflow and streams back its results.
Stable Generate a completion using a previously defined deployment. **Note:** Uses a base url of `https://predict.vellum.ai`.
Stable Generate a stream of completions using a previously defined deployment. **Note:** Uses a base url of `https://predict.vellum.ai`.

get.description: Unstable Used to retrieve a model version given its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this model version.

post.description: Unstable Compiles the prompt backing the model version using the provided input values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this model version.

post.description: Unstable Registers a prompt within Vellum and creates associated Vellum entities. Intended to be used by integration partners, not directly by Vellum users. Under the hood, this endpoint creates a new sandbox, a new model version, and a new deployment.

Unstable Upserts a new scenario for a sandbox, keying off of the optionally provided scenario id. If an id is provided and has a match, the scenario will be updated. If no id is provided or no match is found, a new scenario will be appended to the end. Note that a full replacement of the scenario is performed, so any fields not provided will be removed or overwritten with default values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this sandbox.

Example1.description: This example shows how to specify a scenario with two variables, var_1 and var_2.

chat_history.text: AI's don't have a favorite color.... Yet.

Example2.description: This example shows how to specify a chat history for the special $chat_history variable.

delete.description: Unstable Deletes an existing scenario from a sandbox, keying off of the provided scenario id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this sandbox.

parameters.name: scenario_id
parameters.description: An id identifying the scenario that you'd like to delete

post.description: Stable Perform a search against a document index. **Note:** Uses a base url of `https://predict.vellum.ai`.
Stable Used to submit feedback regarding the quality of previously generated completions. **Note:** Uses a base url of `https://predict.vellum.ai`.

Unstable Upserts a new test case for a test suite, keying off of the optionally provided test case id. If an id is provided and has a match, the test case will be updated. If no id is provided or no match is found, a new test case will be appended to the end. Note that a full replacement of the test case is performed, so any fields not provided will be removed or overwritten with default values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this test suite.

delete.description: Unstable Deletes an existing test case for a test suite, keying off of the test case id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this test suite.

parameters.name: test_case_id
parameters.description: An id identifying the test case that you'd like to delete

post.description: Stable Upload a document to be indexed and used for search. **Note:** Uses a base url of `https://documents.vellum.ai`.

label.description: A human-readable label for the deployment

name.description: A name that uniquely identifies this deployment within its workspace

status.description:
The current status of the deployment

* `ACTIVE` - Active
* `INACTIVE` - Inactive
* `ARCHIVED` - Archived

environment.description:
The environment this deployment is used in

* `DEVELOPMENT` - Development
* `STAGING` - Staging
* `PRODUCTION` - Production

model_type.description:
The type of model this deployment serves

* `GENERATE` - Generate
* `CLASSIFY` - Classify

label.description: The human-readable name for the document.

external_id.description: The unique ID of the document as represented in an external system and specified when it was originally uploaded.

id.description: Vellum-generated ID that uniquely identifies this link.

document_index_id.description: Vellum-generated ID that uniquely identifies the index this document is included in.

indexing_state.description:
An enum value representing where this document is along its indexing lifecycle for this index.

* `AWAITING_PROCESSING` - Awaiting Processing
* `QUEUED` - Queued
* `INDEXING` - Indexing
* `INDEXED` - Indexed
* `FAILED` - Failed

label.description: A human-readable label for the document index

name.description: A name that uniquely identifies this index within its workspace

status.description:
The current status of the document index

* `ACTIVE` - Active
* `ARCHIVED` - Archived

environment.description:
The environment this document index is used in

* `DEVELOPMENT` - Development
* `STAGING` - Staging
* `PRODUCTION` - Production

indexing_config.description: Configuration representing how documents should be indexed

copy_documents_from_index_id.description: Optionally specify the id of a document index from which you'd like to copy and re-index its documents into this newly created index

label.description: A human-readable label for the document index

name.description: A name that uniquely identifies this index within its workspace

status.description:
The current status of the document index

* `ACTIVE` - Active
* `ARCHIVED` - Archived

environment.description:
The environment this document index is used in

* `DEVELOPMENT` - Development
* `STAGING` - Staging
* `PRODUCTION` - Production

indexing_config.description: Configuration representing how documents should be indexed

id.description: The Vellum-generated ID of the completion.

external_id.description: The external ID that was originally provided along with the generation request, which uniquely identifies this generation in an external system.

text.description: The text generated by the LLM.

finish_reason.description:
The reason the generation finished.

* `LENGTH` - LENGTH
* `STOP` - STOP
* `UNKNOWN` - UNKNOWN

logprobs.description: The logprobs of the completion. Only present if specified in the original request options.

model_version_id.description: The ID of the model version used to generate this completion.

target.description: The target value to compare the LLM output against. Typically what you expect or desire the LLM output to be.
The target value to compare the LLM output against. Typically what you expect or desire the LLM output to be.

workflow_deployment_id.description: The ID of the Workflow Deployment. Must provide either this or workflow_deployment_name.

workflow_deployment_name.description: The name of the Workflow Deployment. Must provide either this or workflow_deployment_id.

release_tag.description: Optionally specify a release tag if you want to pin to a specific release of the Workflow Deployment

external_id.description: Optionally include a unique identifier for tracking purposes.

deployment_id.description: The ID of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_name.

deployment_name.description: The name of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_id.

requests.description: The generation requests to make. Supplying multiple will perform a bulk request to the LLM provided when possible.

options.description: Additional configuration that can be used to control what's included in the response.

detail.description: Details about why the request failed.

logprobs.description:
Which logprobs to include, if any. Defaults to NONE.

* `ALL` - ALL
* `NONE` - NONE

input_values.description: Key/value pairs for each template variable defined in the deployment's prompt.

chat_history.description: Optionally provide a list of chat messages that'll be used in place of the special {$chat_history} variable, if included in the prompt.

external_ids.description: Optionally include a unique identifier for each generation, as represented outside of Vellum. Note that this should generally be a list of length one.

results.description: The results of each generation request.

data.description: An object containing the resulting generation. This key will be absent if the LLM provider experienced an error.

error.description: An object containing details about the error that occurred. This key will be absent if the LLM provider did not experience an error.

completions.description: The generated completions. This will generally be a list of length one.

message.description: The error message returned by the LLM provider.

deployment_id.description: The ID of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_name.

deployment_name.description: The name of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_id.

requests.description: The generation requests to make. Supplying multiple will perform a bulk request to the LLM provided when possible.

options.description: Additional configuration that can be used to control what's included in the response.

IndexingStateEnum.description:
* `AWAITING_PROCESSING` - Awaiting Processing
* `QUEUED` - Queued
* `INDEXING` - Indexing
* `INDEXED` - Indexed
* `FAILED` - Failed

base_model.description: The name of the base model used to create this model version, as identified by the LLM provider.

sandbox_snapshot.description: Information about the sandbox snapshot that was used to create this model version, if applicable.

input_values.description: Key/value pairs for each variable found within the model version's prompt template.

text.description: The fully compiled prompt in normalized ChatML syntax after all variable substitutions and templating functions are applied.

num_tokens.description: The approximate number of tokens used by the compiled prompt.

parameters.description: The generation parameters that are passed to the LLM provider at runtime.

input_variables.description: Names of the input variables specified in the prompt template.

prompt_template.description: The template used to generate prompts for this model version.

id.description: Vellum-generated ID that uniquely identifies this model version.

created.description: Timestamp of when this model version was created.

label.description: Human-friendly name for this model version.

model_type.description:
The type of task this model is used for.

* `GENERATE` - Generate
* `CLASSIFY` - Classify

provider.description:
Which LLM provider this model version is associated with.

* `ANTHROPIC` - Anthropic
* `COHERE` - Cohere
* `GOOGLE` - Google
* `HOSTED` - Hosted
* `MOSAICML` - MosaicML
* `MYSTIC` - Mystic
* `OPENAI` - OpenAI
* `PYQ` - Pyq

external_id.description: The unique id of this model version as it exists in the above provider's system.

build_config.description: Configuration used to build this model version.

exec_config.description: Configuration used to execute this model version.

id.description: The ID of the sandbox snapshot.

prompt_index.description: The index of the prompt in the sandbox snapshot.

prompt_id.description: The id of the prompt in the sandbox snapshot.

key.description: The name of the input variable.
The name of the input variable.

ProviderEnum.description:
* `ANTHROPIC` - Anthropic
* `COHERE` - Cohere
* `GOOGLE` - Google
* `HOSTED` - Hosted
* `MOSAICML` - MosaicML
* `MYSTIC` - Mystic
* `OPENAI` - OpenAI
* `PYQ` - Pyq

detail.description: Details about why the request failed.

id.description: The ID of the generated prompt.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the generated prompt.

input_variables.description: Names of the input variables specified in the prompt template.

label.description: A human-friendly label for corresponding entities created in Vellum.

name.description: A uniquely-identifying name for corresponding entities created in Vellum.

prompt.description: Information about how to execute the prompt template.

provider.description:
The initial LLM provider to use for this prompt

* `ANTHROPIC` - Anthropic
* `COHERE` - Cohere
* `GOOGLE` - Google
* `HOSTED` - Hosted
* `MOSAICML` - MosaicML
* `MYSTIC` - Mystic
* `OPENAI` - OpenAI
* `PYQ` - Pyq

model.description: The initial model to use for this prompt

parameters.description: The initial model parameters to use for  this prompt

meta.description: Optionally include additional metadata to store along with the prompt.

sandbox_snapshot.description: Information about the generated sandbox snapshot

model_version.description: Information about the generated model version

id.description: The ID of the generated deployment.

name.description: A uniquely-identifying name for generated deployment.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the generated deployment.

id.description: The ID of the generated model version.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the generated model version.

id.description: The ID of the generated sandbox.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the generated sandbox.

id.description: The ID of the generated sandbox snapshot.

detail.description: Details about why the request failed.

external_ids.description: The document external IDs to filter by

index_id.description: The ID of the index to search against. Must provide either this or index_name.

index_name.description: The name of the index to search against. Must provide either this or index_id.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return.

weights.description: The weights to use for the search. Must add up to 1.0.

filters.description: The filters to apply to the search.

results.description: The results of the search. Each result represents a chunk that matches the search query.

document.description: The document that contains the chunk that matched the search query.

text.description: The text of the chunk that matched the search query.

score.description: A score representing how well the chunk matches the search query.

semantic_similarity.description: The relative weight to give to semantic similarity

keywords.description: The relative weight to give to keyword matches

id.description: Vellum-generated ID that uniquely identifies this document.

external_id.description: The external ID that was originally provided when uploading the document.

last_uploaded_at.description: A timestamp representing when this document was most recently uploaded.

processing_state.description:
An enum value representing where this document is along its processing lifecycle. Note that this is different than its indexing lifecycle.

* `QUEUED` - Queued
* `PROCESSING` - Processing
* `PROCESSED` - Processed
* `FAILED` - Failed

processing_failure_reason.description:
An enum value representing why the document could not be processed. Is null unless processing_state is FAILED.

* `EXCEEDED_CHARACTER_LIMIT` - Exceeded Character Limit

keywords.description: A list of keywords associated with this document. Originally provided when uploading the document.

id.description: The Vellum-generated ID of a previously generated completion. Must provide either this or external_id.

external_id.description: The external ID that was originally provided when generating the completion that you'd now like to submit actuals for. Must provide either this or id.

text.description: Text representing what the completion _should_ have been.

quality.description: A number between 0 and 1 representing the quality of the completion. 0 is the worst, 1 is the best.

timestamp.description: Optionally provide the timestamp representing when this feedback was collected. Used for reporting purposes.

deployment_id.description: The ID of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_name.

deployment_name.description: The name of the deployment. Must provide either this or deployment_id.

actuals.description: Feedback regarding the quality of previously generated completions

name.description: The unique name given to the terminal node that produced this output.
The unique name given to the terminal node that produced this output.
The unique name given to the terminal node that produced this output.

test_case_id.description: The id of the test case to update. If none is provided, an id will be generated and a new test case will be appended.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the test case.

input_values.description: Key/value pairs for each input variable that the Test Suite expects.

evaluation_params.description: Parameters to use when evaluating the test case, specific to the test suite's evaluation metric.

test_case_id.description: The id of the test case to update. If none is provided, an id will be generated and a new test case will be appended.

label.description: A human-friendly label for the test case.

input_values.description: Key/value pairs for each input variable that the Test Suite expects.

evaluation_params.description: Parameters to use when evaluating the test case, specific to the test suite's evaluation metric.

add_to_index_names.description: Optionally include the names of all indexes that you'd like this document to be included in

external_id.description: Optionally include an external ID for this document. This is useful if you want to re-upload the same document later when its contents change and would like it to be re-indexed.

label.description: A human-friendly name for this document. Typically the filename.

contents.description: The file contents of the document.

keywords.description: Optionally include a list of keywords that'll be associated with this document. Used when performing keyword searches.

document_id.description: The ID of the newly created document.

scenario_id.description: The id of the scenario to update. If none is provided, an id will be generated and a new scenario will be appended.

name.description: The variable's name, as defined in the Workflow.
The variable's name, as defined in the Workflow.
The variable's name, as defined in the Workflow.

delta.description: The newly output string value. Only relevant for string outputs with a state of STREAMING.
The newly output string value. Only relevant for string outputs with a state of STREAMING.
The newly output string value, meant to be concatenated with all previous. Will be non-null for events of state STREAMING.

value.description: The entire string value. Will be non-null for events of state FULFILLED.
